net.truelicense.api

Interface ConsumerLicenseManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ContextProvider<LicenseManagementContext>, LicenseManagementParametersProvider, LicenseManagementSchema
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    UncheckedConsumerLicenseManager

    public interface ConsumerLicenseManager
extends LicenseManagementSchema
    Defines the life cycle management operations for license keys in consumer applications.

    How to Preview License Keys

    This interface intentionally lacks a method to preview the license bean which is encoded in a license key. You can work around this constraint by using a license management context to configure a consumer license manager which uses a transient memory store instead of a persistent store - see ConsumerLicenseManagerBuilder.storeIn(net.truelicense.api.io.Store). Once configured, you can install the license key to the transient memory store and load its encoded license bean.

    Author:
    Christian Schlichtherle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void install(Source source)
      Verifies the digital signature of the license key and copies it to the configured store.
      License load()

      void uninstall()
      Uninstalls the installed license key.
      void verify()
      Eventually loads the installed license key and verifies its encoded license bean.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.truelicense.api.misc.ContextProvider

    • Method Detail

      • install

        void install(Source source)
      throws LicenseManagementException
        Verifies the digital signature of the license key and copies it to the configured store. Unlike verify(), this operation does not validate the encoded license bean. This enables the caller to obtain a duplicate of the license bean even if its validation would fail, e.g. if the license has expired.

        Calling this operation performs an initial authorization check.

        Parameters:
        source - the source for loading the license key.
        Throws:
        LicenseManagementException

      • load

        License load()
      throws LicenseManagementException
        Eventually loads the installed license key and returns an unvalidated duplicate of its encoded license bean. Unlike verify(), this operation does not validate the encoded license bean. This enables the caller to obtain a duplicate of the license bean even if its validation would fail, e.g. if the license has expired.

        Calling this operation performs an initial authorization check.

        Returns:
        An unvalidated duplicate of the license bean which is encoded in the installed license key.
        Throws:
        LicenseManagementException

      • uninstall

        void uninstall()
        throws LicenseManagementException
        Uninstalls the installed license key.

        Calling this operation performs an initial authorization check.

        Throws:
        LicenseManagementException

      • verify

        void verify()
     throws LicenseManagementException
        Eventually loads the installed license key and verifies its encoded license bean. You should call this method whenever you want to verify access to a feature of your software product. Execution needs to be fast in order to support frequent calling.

        Calling this operation performs an initial authorization check.

        Throws:
        LicenseValidationException - if validating the license bean fails, e.g. if the license has expired.
        LicenseManagementException
